result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Jo Braaflat is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa Jo Braaflat was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (11/16/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

Defendant to perform an ADDITIONAL 30 hours (to the 30 hours ordered in 14CF290) uncompensated Community Service by 1/15/16 (to be monitored by TAD DPA). On or before 1/15/16, Defendant must file an additional form verifying that she has completed same in this case.
Consecutive to: Community service ordered in 14CF290

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 14CF290, 15CF150 No appearances. Court orders wage assigment.
Payment hearing on June 28, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Cases called 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 1:12 pm. Defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Adata Axelson and Jay Westhuis appears with TAD program.  Ms. Axelson is heard, requests full graduation.  1:26 pm, Yolanda Tienstra now appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Tienstra moves to dismiss with prejudice the TAD DPA.  Atty. Devitt is in agreement.  Court accepts Community service certificate on cases 14CF290 and 15CF150.  14CF267 - Court presents graduation certificate - case is dismissed with prejudice.

(10:36) 14CF267, 14CF290, 15CF150, 15CT75: Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is Sent. on 14CF267 (DPA) & 14CF290 and STC on 15CF150 & 15CT75; Amended Information filed in 15CF150; State heard - Joint recomm. on all and heard on same; Def. has valid DL; discussion held on other counts; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 1 Misd. BJ in 15CF150; Court finds plea in 15CF150 is made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Misd. BJ w/Count 2 dismissed; Court notes Counts 2, 3 & 4 in 14CF267 were to have been D&RI as of 1/9/15 plea hearing and so orders and 15CT75 is dismissed; State heard; Atty. Devitt heard; Court imposes sentence

14CF267: TAD DPA - no action, DPA cont. (Counts 2, 3 & 4 are D&RI as of 1/9/15)

14CF290: Misd. BJ - NC plea entered 1/9/15
 - 30 hours community service by 1/15/2016 (monitored by TAD DPA) - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge

15CT75; Dismissed

15CF150: Misd. BJ (dismiss Count 2)
- Additional 30 hours CS by 1/15/16 - On or before 1/15/16, Def. must file a form that she has done CS, signed by authorized person 
- CC w/in 60 days or payment plan
- DNA surcharge

(1:33) 14CF267, 15CF150 & 15CT75: Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Devitt requests cases set for STC on 9/10/15 at 1:30 w/14CF290 & 14CF267 (DPA case); Court orders 15CF150 & 15CT75 set for STC on 9/10/15

(14CF267, 15CF134 & 15CT150) Defendant Melissa Jo Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews waiver filed in 15CF134  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney bill for this case is in 14CF267

14CF267, 15CT75, 15CF150  Defendant Melissa  Braaflat in court with attorney Michael Robert Devitt.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klomberg heard, Atty Devitt heard, state moves to quash warrant, court quashes warrant, Atty Devitt waives time limits for the preliminary hearing, court appoints Atty Devitt on this case, court does an initial appearance on 15CF150,   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 signature bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.    Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.Court orders her to pay $500 down by 6/25 and court will review that on that date.
Attorney Michael Robert Devitt appeared. Atty is appointed on 3 other cases; heard on defendant. ADA Sempf for State. Defendant FTA. Court issues WA; stays until Friday at 10:00 am.
from Atty Devitt re: appointment of counsel
